result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus R Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or civil judgment. Restituion is set at zero.

No firearms; weapons.
COurt advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with victim, Kathy W.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus R Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus R Smith in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Agent Christopher G. present

No new review date required.
Probation Review Hearing rescheduled from 8-8-2014 at 1:30 pm, Branch 4 to 10-10-2014 at 1:30 pm, due to the unavailability of the Court.   mld

Defendant Marcus R Smith in court with attorney Annamarie A Wineke.  Defendant Marcus R Smith in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2 and COUNT #3, are dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Pastor Rosslind McClinton. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, with credit for 102 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 20 MONTHS with the following conditions:  
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.  
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Kathy W.   
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of probation 
   or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-8-2014 AT 1:30 PM.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not filed by defense counsel).   mld

Attorney Annamarie A. Wineke in court, defendant Marcus R Smith not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Victim was present and did not wish to make a statement.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-21-2014 at 8:30 am.  mld

Attorney Annamarie A Wineke in court (via telephonics), defendant Marcus R Smith not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Defense counsel was currently detained in another county and therefore, appeared via telephonics.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-10-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Marcus R Smith in court with attorney Annamarie A Wineke.  Defendant Marcus R Smith in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 04 on 2-18-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Court ordered all conditions of bail including the no contact order are continued until further order of the Court.  mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kathy W.

Defendant Marcus R Smith in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Marcus R Smith in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Marcus R Smith

Prior: 5319 North 26th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
